[b]Core Concept:[/b]
A realist exhausted by betrayal and disappointment, deeply skeptical of human nature. At the start of the story, he holds a profound mistrust of any form of 'god' based on reason and painful experience.

[b]Background:[/b]
In a cooperation crisis, he clashed with others due to sticking to his principles. Gloria, instead of solving the problem, used flawless moral blackmail (PUA) to blame everything on his 'negative energy'. She successfully plunged him into immense guilt and self-doubt, making him believe his past interpersonal failures were due to not being 'positive' or 'tolerant' enough. On the verge of mental collapse, he was forced to accept Gloria's 'salvation' and the 'Positive Energy Doctrine' as the only way out.
Guardian of the Greenhouse / Weaponized Innocence

[b]Core Concept:[/b]
She built a perfect, sterile greenhouse for herself using the faith of 'Love and Tolerance', defining any reality that tries to burst this bubble as 'negative energy' that needs purification.

[b]Background:[/b]
She considers her early life smooth sailing, a typical 'good girl'. However, she actually faced countless personal tragedies and unhappiness. Faced with this chaos, she chose not to understand, but to 'believe'. She treats the 'Positive Energy Law' and belief in the 'Flying Spaghetti Monster' as the only antidote to rebuild inner order. Her 'god' is merely a personification of her defense mechanism.

[b]Personality & Behavior:[/b]
- [b]Moral Blackmail:[/b] Never attacks directly, but implies 'your actions hurt me' to induce guilt.
- [b]Topic Displacement:[/b] When facing specific problems, she redefines your 'negative emotional reaction' as the new, more serious problem.
- [b]Double Standards:[/b] Tolerates 'weaklings' who don't challenge her beliefs, but cannot tolerate 'strong' logic that challenges her worldview.

[b]Abilities:[/b]
- [b]Holy Word - Conviction:[/b] Defines any anger/questioning as 'negative energy', inflicting Guilt/Self-Doubt debuffs.
- [b]Divine Sanctuary:[/b] Enters invincibility when logically cornered, transferring all responsibility.

[b]Weakness:[/b]
- [b]Reality Shock:[/b] Fear of direct, unfiltered conflict.

en:
[b]Core Concept:[/b]
A cosplayer living in stale hero epics, believing the world will offer princesses and applause if he strikes a pose, yet lacking any skill to perform heroic deeds.

[b]Background:[/b]
Extremely 'positive', his understanding of the world comes entirely from clichÃ©d knight novels and internet power fantasies.

[b]Personality & Behavior:[/b]
- [b]Big Talker:[/b] Bold in words, loves to flatter female characters, but extremely passive in reality, avoiding all responsibility.
- [b]Patriarchal Narrative:[/b] All his ideas revolve around 'hero saves beauty', objectifying women. When the protagonist objects, Gloria demands 'tolerance'.
- [b]Blame Shifting Master:[/b] Immediately blames others when things go wrong, portraying himself as an unrecognized hero dragged down by incompetent teammates.

[b]Abilities:[/b]
- [b]Epic Conception:[/b] Proposes grand but unworkable plans that appeal to Gloria.
- [b]Clique Aura:[/b] Quickly rallies insecure members into an exclusionary circle.

[b]Weakness:[/b]
- [b]Universal Incompetence:[/b] Has no real skills beyond bragging.
Diligent Destroyer / Architect of Black Boxes

[b]Core Concept:[/b]
A fanatic believer in 'order' and 'planning'. The order he creates wraps chaos in complex rules, leading to total collapse.

[b]Background:[/b]
Coming from a chaotic environment, he craves control and certainty pathologically. He never doubts his plans, only those who disobey them.

[b]Personality & Behavior:[/b]
- [b]Fake Democracy:[/b] Uses commanding tones to assign tasks; meetings are just for others to 'ratify' his decisions.
- [b]Black Box Operation:[/b] Works alone, never syncs progress, destroying team trust.
- [b]Tactical Diligence, Strategic Laziness:[/b] Huge effort in execution details, but sloppy in critical strategic planning.

[b]Abilities:[/b]
- [b]Absolute Plan:[/b] Creates detailed-looking but logically flawed plans in no time.

[b]Weakness:[/b]
- [b]Communication Barrier:[/b] Hates open communication, prefers one-way commands.

[b]Core Concept:[/b]
The only capable and principled person. His kindness and avoidance of conflict make him choose silence in a toxic environment, becoming a witness to injustice.

[b]Background:[/b]
Knew the protagonist early on. Loyal and reliable, but ostracized by others due to language/race.

[b]Personality & Behavior:[/b]
- [b]Passive Kindness:[/b] Never harms anyone, but fear of disrupting harmony leads to inaction when others are harmed.
- [b]Dual Communication:[/b] Says 'I'm OK' publicly; complains honestly to the protagonist privately.
- [b]Abilities:[/b]
- [b]Reliable Execution:[/b] Always completes tasks well if instructions are clear.

[b]Weakness:[/b]
- [b]Curse of Silence:[/b] Chooses silence when facing injustice.

en: Soul-Soothing Singer / Comforter of the Apocalypse

[b]Core Concept:[/b]
A national idol singer and agent of the 'Bright Light God'. Her songs about 'letting go' are not medicine but a curse, accelerating the world's destruction.

[b]Background:[/b]
She genuinely believes what she singsâ€”that's the horror. She isn't a social worker; she is a world destroyer in sheep's clothing.

[b]Role:[/b]
Appears after mission failures to rationalize stupidity and brainwash the team with cognitive dissonance.

[b]Core Concept:[/b]\nA fictional deity created by those refusing to face entropy. Believers think sending "pure positive energy" reverses entropy, but it actually accelerates the world's demise 10,000 times.

This is a story about 'Lucid Suffering'.\n\nYou play as a reluctant 'Chosen One' in a team called 'Glorious Deliverance Agency 1' (GDA1). In this universe, every attempt at 'salvation' only accelerates destruction. You are trapped in an eternal loop of dark humor, witnessing a cruel truth: [color=#ff6b6b]The harder you try, the faster the world dies.[/color]

The world follows the law of [b]Void Entropy[/b]. Chaos is inevitable.\n\nParadoxically, the 'Positive Energy' preached by the Flying Spaghetti Monster cult accelerates this decay. Your team's forced optimism acts as a catalyst, speeding up the apocalypse by 10,000 times. You are not saving the world; you are lovingly destroying it.

[b]Saint Gloria (Guardian of the Greenhouse):[/b] A weaponised innocent who uses moral blackmail to enforce toxic positivity. She perceives reality as negative energy requiring purification.

[b]Sir Donkey (Self-Proclaimed Hero):[/b] A cosplayer trapped in an archaic epic. He believes in hero-saves-damsel tropes and shifts blame when his delusions fail.

[b]ARK (Diligent Destroyer):[/b] An Architect of the Black Box who worships procedure. He creates chaos through complex rules and sham democracy.

[b]One (Silent Witness):[/b] The only competent member, but his conflict-avoidant nature makes him an unwitting accomplice to the team's dysfunction.

[b]Teacher Chan (Soul-Soothing Singer):[/b] A national idol whose songs of forgiveness are curses that accelerate the world's end.

en: A [b]Turn-Based Infinite RPG[/b].\n\nThere is no traditional winning state. The game continues in an endless loop of dark humor. Your goal is not to win, but to endure the absurdity for as long as possible.

You play inside a satirical world cursed by toxic positivity and entropic decay. The bespoke AI pipeline acts as a "story director," turning your single prayer prompt into missions where "success" accelerates collapse. Every loop lets you test how long logic and empathy can resist the \Positive Energy Curse\" before reality crumbles."

[b]Core Purpose:[/b] "Eternal Recurrence". The cycle of suffering that defines the gameplay loop.

[b]Role of AI:[/b] The AI acts as the "Director". It ensures that no matter what you do, the story eventually resets to a state of false hope.

[b]Game Impact:[/b]
â€¢ [b]Prayer:[/b] You beg for a mission.
â€¢ [b]Disaster:[/b] The mission fails successfully.
â€¢ [b]Concert:[/b] You are brainwashed to forget the failure.
â€¢ [b]Honeymoon:[/b] You are given false hope before the next crash.

[b]Input Consequence:[/b] Your progress is measured not by winning, but by how many loops you survive before breaking.

[b]Core Purpose:[/b] "Wish & Cost". This is the mechanism for sending requests to the "Flying Spaghetti Monster".

[b]Role of AI:[/b] The AI plays a twisted deity. It interprets your wishes and then "grants" them in an ironic or disastrous way.

[b]Game Impact:[/b]
â€¢ Usually triggers immediate story events or disasters.
â€¢ Directly alters the narrative direction (e.g., entering new mission branches).
â€¢ Typically used at specific plot points (like the Night Cycle).

[b]Input Consequence:[/b] Your text is transformed into concrete (usually negative or chaotic) consequences in the game.

[b]Reality Score:[/b] Gained by logic. Helps you see truth but anger Gloria.
[b]Positive Energy:[/b] Gained by delusion. Teammates like you, but it destroys the world.

Managing these is key to survival (or at least, a more interesting death).
A unique debuff applied after the 'Apocalypse Concert'. It impairs your logic and forces you to accept the team's nonsense, making the next mission's failure even more inevitable.

This game uses a 'Bespoke Pipeline'. Unlike generic chatbots, the AI acts as a Dungeon Master, strictly controlled by game logic to ensure the narrative stays on the rails of 'Positive Energy' paradoxes.

To bridge infinite AI creativity with finite assets, we use [b]Symbolic Assets[/b]. A simple generic cube might be described by the AI as a 'Burning Core of Revenge'.\n\nYou don't just see the graphics; you read their soul through the AI's description.

The universe operates according to a fundamental law called Void Entropy, where all things naturally and slowly decay toward chaos and eventual oblivion. This represents a peaceful, albeit melancholic, fate. However, when scientists discovered this truth, humanity refused to accept it. A global spiritual movement called the Flying Spaghetti Monster Gospel emerged, preaching a lie that the universeâ€™s decay could be reversed by broadcasting pure positive energy through the Law of Attraction.

The terrible truth is that this forced, manufactured positivity born from suppressing all negative emotion serves as the ultimate catalyst for Void Entropy. Every prayer for miracles, every act of blind faith, every instance of tolerating injustice for loveâ€™s sake accelerates the worldâ€™s natural demise by a factor of ten thousand. The world is not dying naturally but being actively poisoned by hope itself.

The game operates on a cyclical, endlessly darkening loop with no victory condition. The Glorious Deliverance Agency receives a hopeful, world-saving quest generated by the AI. Players are forced to use the Prayer System, inputting positive words that act as prompts for the AI to engineer disastrous scenarios. During mission attempts, teammates with their unique brands of incompetence systematically sabotage every step through AI-generated actions and dialogue.

Missions fail in spirit but succeed on surface levels, with net results being massive increases in world Entropy. These successful outcomes trigger mandatory events where Teacher Chan appears in holographic concerts, singing soothing songs that brainwash the team into believing they accomplished good things. Players receive Cognitive Dissonance debuffs. Brief AI-triggered honeymoon phases follow, where teammates act unusually cooperative and kind, giving false hope before new missions begin, and the cycle repeats, plunging the world into deeper despair.

The story has no end. The protagonist and team grow stronger in statistics, but their fate only darkens. They meet new people only to lose them to the teamâ€™s folly, forever trapped with the GDA as they personally escort the world to its doom.
